snippet: Losing intentionally — which disqualified four badminton teams at the Olympics — infuriates many, but it has its defenders as a strategy, even at the Games.
abstract: Losing intentionally at the Olympics, which disqualifies four women's badminton teams, infuriates many, but it has its defenders as a strategy, even at the Games; eight players are found to have tried to lose their matches intentionally, apparently because they believe a loss would allow them to play a weaker opponent in the next round.
lead_paragraph: Losing intentionally — which disqualified four badminton teams at the Olympics — infuriates many, but it has its defenders as a strategy, even at the Games.

headline.seo: Olympic Badminton Teams Ousted for Throwing Matches
